questions.explanation:
Frasier.

	Rebecca was having financial problems and told Frasier she was going to have to sell it. Frasier offered to buy it for $5000, she said $6000 and he agreed to that.

questions.text: Where did Frasier say there was barometric pressure?
questions.explanation:
Venus.

	He was reading something and told Sam that there was barometric pressure on Venus. He continued to talk non-stop to Sam until Sam asked, "somebody want to play with Frasier, please?"

questions.text: Who was picking up trash for the city?
questions.explanation:
Robin.

	As part of Robin's community service work he had to pick up trash. Carla enjoyed flirting with the men that were outside picking up the trash.

questions.text: Where did Woody, Norm and Cliff go to dinner?
questions.explanation:
The Hungry Heifer.

	The Hungry Heifer was one of Norm's favorite restaurants. The food was extremely unhealthy.

questions.text: What was going to happen to the restaurant that Norm liked so much?
questions.correct: It was going to be torn down.
options: It won restaurant of the year.
It was being investigated for tax evasion.
questions.explanation:
It was going to be torn down.

	Norm was very upset about this news. He decided he was going to do something about it.

questions.text: Who was enjoying the fact that a certain character had to pick up trash?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam thought it was amusing that this rich man was reduced to picking up trash on the sides of streets. He mostly enjoyed teasing Rebecca about it.

questions.text: Who was the owner of Norm's favorite restaurant?
questions.explanation:
Sid Nelson.

	Sid Nelson was played by Sheldon Leonard. Sheldon Leonard was in many films including "Guys and Dolls" where he played Harry the Horse.

Carla.

	She wanted to wash cars to attract the men who were picking up trash. She told Rebecca she should do it to, but Rebecca was only interested in one man...Robin.

questions.text: How did Norm save his favorite restaurant?
questions.correct: He had it declared a land mark.
options: He threatened to kill anyone that messed with it.
questions.explanation:
He had it declared a land mark.

	Norm told them, "It turns out that the Hungry Heifer is the only building on the entire Eastern Seaboard that has a giant red-eyed steam-snorting bull on the roof." This brought on a discussion of how the restaurants had changed and not many originals were around anymore.

questions.text: Who wanted to burn down Norm's favorite restaurant?
questions.explanation:
The owner.

	Sid wanted to burn the place down because he felt that he'd been causing all those people health problems by feeding them all that greasy food. He told Norm he was the son he never had and asked him to burn the place down. When Norm refused he got an employee to do it and then said, "Now he's the son I never had."
